Business Analyst - Currently remote - job post TAA Solutions LLC Oakland, CA • Remote $23.49 - $60.11 an hour -  Full-time, Contract Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $23.49 - $60.11 an hour Job Type Full-time Contract The work model is currently 100% remote; however, to be eligible the Consultant must currently reside in the San Francisco Bay Area. We are looking for a highly motivated hybrid Project Manager / Business Analyst with strong organizational, analytical, communication and problem-solving skills. This position will be a key facilitator in a health care setting, for the end-to-end development of data and other projects relating to patient tools. This role is on the Product Team and while it requires technical aptitude, the best candidate will have excellent communication skills and a high focus on customer service. This individual must be curious and have the aptitude to process and manage technical concepts and workflows. He/she must possess the ability to use the appropriate tools and techniques to plan, manage, communicate, and ensure the progress and completion of projects across a variety of groups, subject matter experts and stakeholders. RESPONSIBILITIES: · Lead subject matter experts and product owners from various technical teams to plan and manage activities within project stages and track progress. · Accountable for managing an overall project plan, tracking deliverables, facilitating meetings, and escalating issues prior to their impacting the critical path. · Knowledge of end-to-end project lifecycles and multiple software development frameworks (e.g., Waterfall, Agile). This includes an understanding of methodology attributes such as entrance and exit criteria for each project stage, team roles and responsibilities, and tools and techniques. · Working knowledge of project management software tools and applications. This includes the ability to frequently and independently apply this knowledge to work situations. · An understanding of the business analyst’s role and a willingness to lean into capturing requirements and doing documentation where needed. · The ability to determine when and where a deliverable is in jeopardy and when and to whom to escalate the risk. This includes the ability to develop and recommend mitigation strategies. · Able to work across programs and on multiple parallel tasks. · Demonstrated ability to function both as an organizer and as a thought leader. REQUIREMENTS: · Minimum of 4 years of project management and 3 years business analyst experience. · Exceptional communication & exceptional customer service skills. · Hands on experience with Smartsheet, MS Project, Excel, Visio and other tools. · Experience and understanding of large data projects. · Understanding of Information Management and development concepts · Bachelor’s degree required; Master’s degree preferred. · Health Care or engineering experience preferred. PMP, Agile Certifications a plus. Job Types: Full-time, Contract Pay: $23.49 - $60.11 per hour Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Health insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Overtime Weekend availability Application Question(s): Do you have experience with Smartsheets? What is your visa status? What is the pay rate you are looking for? Are you open to hybrid work? Contract Business Analyst - job post Eversheds Sutherland 39 reviews San Francisco, CA 94111 $40 - $80 an hour -  Contract Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $40 - $80 an hour Job Type Contract We have an exciting opportunity for a Contract Business Analyst at Eversheds Sutherland (US) LLP. We are searching for someone who wants to be a valued contributor and member of a talented and dynamic team of lawyers, paralegals and staff. The Contract Business Analyst is responsible for the requirements from elicitation to implementation ensuring the end solution meets the business needs. The Contract Business Analyst works closely with internal customers and IT teams to define, manage and document requirements for several concurrent initiatives. Responsibilities and Duties: Gathers, understands, analyzes, and documents the need of project stakeholders, formalizing the needs into a set of actionable business requirements. Analyzes, evaluates, and documents the current business processes and identifies future state, including business process modeling. Leads and completes vendor and software selection assessment, as needed. Schedules, plans, and leads requirement gathering and review meetings. Documents and communicates key decisions and actions items. Partners on development and implementation of standard business analysis tools and methodologies with BA team and PMO Manager. Monitors cross-functional deliverables ensuring timely completion of requirement analysis and solution design. Supports change management. Researches and reviews up-to-date business processes and new IT advancements to make systems more modern. Engages with stakeholders at all levels. Performs user acceptance testing. Delivers engaging, informative, well-organized presentations to project sponsors and team members. Clearly communicates project issues and proposed mitigations to stakeholders and management. Collaborates with project managers and cross-functional teams throughout the project implementation cycle, as needed. Manages competing resources and priorities. Coordinates the day-to-day operational aspects of an initiative with PMO Manager. Applies and understands the full analysis process: Defining scope Identifying project benefits Developing business cases Requirements elicitation and management Process optimisation Business change management Requirements tractability to business benefits Input into testing Facilitating user acceptance testing Benefits realization Other duties as assigned. Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: A Bachelor’s degree is required in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration, or related field, from an accredited college or university or an equivalent combination of an Associate degree with related job experience. Required Certifications: Industry recognized Business Analyst Certification (CAP or PBA or IIBA etc.) or Project Management Certification (PMP, SCM etc.) Five-seven years of experience working in a Technology Department is required, with a preference given for work experience in a multi-office legal environment. A minimum of five years of experience in leading projects as a business analyst. Familiar with software development methodologies such as Waterfall and Agile Excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills are required. Detail-oriented and organized. Ability to multi-task and prioritize workloads. Ability to present ideas in a business-friendly and user-friendly language. Strong problem solving and decision-making skills. Excellent computer skills and knowledge of MS Office Suite with proficiency in Outlook are required. Salary is commensurate with years of experience and geographic location. The hourly rate for this position will be $40-80/hr. Eversheds Sutherland (US) LLP is committed to promoting diversity and inclusion within our Firm and in the larger legal profession. We believe that diverse skills, knowledge and viewpoints make us a stronger firm. Eversheds Sutherland (US) LLP maintains a policy of affording all employees and applicants equal employment opportunities without regard to actual or perceived race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender (including gender identity or expression or transgender status), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital or familial status, domestic violence victim status, ancestry, amnesty, citizenship status, military and veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Unlawful discrimination, harassment and retaliation will not be tolerated in any of the Firm’s offices or any other work-related setting. Qualified individuals with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation in order to apply for a position or to enable them to perform the essential functions of a position for which they are otherwise qualified.
